Package uk.ac.aber.cs221.gp12.game

Class Game

java.lang.Object
uk.ac.aber.cs221.gp12.game.Game
public class Game extends Object
This class constructs and describes the features of a Game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()

  • Method Details

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      This is the method which sets and changes the state to start the game.

    • loadGame

      public void loadGame()
      This method is used to load the saved states of the game from a json file. The game will save the state and start running from there.

    • setupGameSettings

      public void setupGameSettings()
      This method is the one which defaults all the player stats, starts up the map, introduces the crew card deck and gives some to players, inputs the treasures, and starts up player turns.

    • setupPlayerTurns

      public void setupPlayerTurns()
      This method gives the players in the game turns, and makes the game go through the players turn states.

    • setupEndGameState

      public void setupEndGameState​(Player player)
      This method starts up the endgame state, which finalises the game.
      Parameters:
      player - - This is the winner of the game, the one who triggers this state.

    • setupAttackResultState

      public void setupAttackResultState​(Player losingPlayer)
      This method sets the state which happens after an attack has taken place.
      Parameters:
      losingPlayer - - This is the loser in the attack, the player who triggers this state.

    • nextGameState

      public void nextGameState()
      This method triggers the state which happens after a game is finished a new one is started. It's only used for new game, or when the game crashes in startup.

    • validPosition

      public boolean validPosition​(int x, int y)
      This method checks that the player's original position at the start of the game is valid and within the needed requirements of the game. Making sure they're on the map, and they're assigned ports.
      Parameters:
      x - - the starting x position of the player.
      y - - the starting y position of the player.
      Returns:
      true if the position is valid, false if it isn't.

    • getMapObject

      public GameObject getMapObject​(int x, int y)
      This method makes sure that the map used for the game is complying with the minimum and maximum position set out in the UI section of the game.
      Parameters:
      x - - the max and min position x can be.
      y - - the max and min position y can be.
      Returns:
      the map object for the game.

    • triggeredMapObject

      public void triggeredMapObject​(Player player, int x, int y)
      This method makes sure that the map object that was triggered to play the game in works with a player in it and is functional to carry out the game.
      Parameters:
      player - - the player in the game which triggers the action.
      x - - the max and min position x can be.
      y - - the max and min position y can be.

    • triggeredPlayer

      public Player triggeredPlayer​(Player player, int x, int y)
      This method makes sure that there is an appropriate amount of players, and they're in the right positions at the stater and during the game to follow requirements.
      Parameters:
      player - - The players in the game.
      x - - the max and min position x can be.
      y - - the max and min position y can be.
      Returns:
      the players playing the game and a change of state.

    • getMinPos

      public int getMinPos()
      This method gets the minimum position a player can be in during the game.
      Returns:
      the minimum position a player can be during the game

    • getMaxPos

      public int getMaxPos()
      This method gets the maximum position a player can be in during the game.
      Returns:
      the maximum position a player can be during the game

    • getPlayers

      public Player[] getPlayers()
      This method gets the array of players playing in the game at all times.
      Returns:
      the array of players in the game.

    • getHarbours

      public Harbour[] getHarbours()
      This method gets the array of harbours in the game.
      Returns:
      the array of players in the game.

    • getPirateIsland

      public PirateIsland getPirateIsland()
      This method gets the crew card info on Pirate Island
      Returns:
      the information on Pirate Island.

    • getTreasureIsland

      public TreasureIsland getTreasureIsland()
      This method gets the crew card and treasure info on Treasure Island
      Returns:
      the information on Treasure Island.

    • getFlatIsland

      public FlatIsland getFlatIsland()
      This method gets the crew card and treasure info on Flat Island
      Returns:
      the information on Flat Island.

    • getMudbay

      public Mudbay getMudbay()
      This method gets info on Mud Bay
      Returns:
      the information on Mud Bay.

    • getCliffCreek

      public CliffCreek getCliffCreek()
      This method gets the info on Cliff's Creek
      Returns:
      the information on Cliff's Creek.

    • getAnchorBay

      public AnchorBay getAnchorBay()
      This method gets the info on Anchor Bay
      Returns:
      the information on Anchor Bay.

    • getTreasureDetails

      public List<TreasureDetail> getTreasureDetails()
      This method gets a list of all the treasure's names and values present in the game.
      Returns:
      the info of all the treasures in the game.

    • searchPlayer

      public Player searchPlayer​(String name)
      This method looks for a specific player in the game based on a name search.
      Parameters:
      name - - The name of the player the game is looking for.
      Returns:
      the player which name matches the search.
